meanings.definition: The amount that a trunk can hold.
meanings.sent1: The elephant carried a trunksful of bananas in its trunk.
meanings.sent2: She packed a trunksful of clothes for her weekend trip.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to fit a trunksful of acorns in its tiny cheeks.
meanings.sent4: His heart was a trunksful of memories, each one precious.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was overflowing, a trunksful of gold coins spilling out.

meanings.sent1: The travelers each carried trunksful of souvenirs from their trip.
meanings.sent2: The gardeners collected trunksful of fallen leaves to compost.
meanings.sent3: The kids had trunksful of toys scattered all over the playroom.
meanings.sent4: The library shelves were trunksful of books waiting to be read.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors selling trunksful of fresh fruits and vegetables.
